page.title: 16LANIVET PARISH
page.content: The houses in our 12 square kilometres are made of several building materials -stone, brick and granite. Some of the houses are decorated outside with ornaments, baskets of flowers or cartwheels. The gateposts are often made of granite and granite blocks are sometimes used in garden designs.The oldest houses are near the Green and church, some looking like old mining cottages. (There used to be mines near Lamorick - one was called Wheal Prosper). There are new housing estates at Woodland View and Woodland Glade built within the last fifteen years.Some of the businesses in the area benefit from the summer tourism- B and B, two fish and chip shops, the petrol filling station and a pub.There are two old people's homes, one private and one council, both some distance from the shops and centre.
